critique: The document expresses strong disapproval and decisiveness regarding the US withdrawal from the WHO. The tone is assertive and aims to justify the withdrawal by highlighting the WHO's alleged failures and disproportionate financial demands. There is a clear intent to convey a sense of justification and resolve. The emotions that the American public is expected to feel are disgust, fear, sadness, and surprise. Disgust is related to the mishandling of the COVID-19 pandemic. Fear is related to global health crises. Sadness is related to the withdrawal from the WHO. Surprise is related to the sudden withdrawal from the WHO.
